jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:46): thomasmortagne: dan\_miron Hello :) re the XTXARPLUGIN issue with the package.xml taken from target/classes  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:47): it seems that the plugin takes everything from that directory, and relies on the fact that the resources have been copied there  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:48): I don't know if it's the correct behavior or not. I suppose it is, since vmassol wrote it :p   
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:49): jvelociter: yes resources are meant to be in src/main/resources and are copied in target/classes by the resource plugin  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:49): it's important we take them from there  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:49): since there can other plugins/tx that make modifications to them too  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:49): ok. In the case here, we have an issue since the plugin appends .xml to the document that do not have the extensions  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:49): so we only need to ensure that the resource plugin is executed  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:50): jvelociter: I don't think it should do that  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:50): again the plugin should have only 1 behavior  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:50): then we building a second file, the mojo finds a package.xml in target/classes (created by the first build)  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:50): having files without XML extension is a build error  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:50): (since we want xml file extensions)  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:50): no having file without xml extension is not a problem  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:51): the progin should not touch files  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:51): progin=plugin  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:51): so why did you say that:  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:51): it just have to filter them  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:51): "we have an issue since the plugin appends .xml to the document that do not have the extensions"  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:51): ?  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:51): i don't understand whi it add extension  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:51): ah right  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:51): we agree  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:51): but it could also fail  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:51): with an exception  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:52): if invalid files are detected  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:52): this yes but it has nothing to do with exception  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:52): extension  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:52): sorry  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:52): ok I'm a bit lost but I'm not sure what you're asking either  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:52): maybe I'm just jumping on an existing discussion  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 14:53): let me know if you need my help somewhere  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:54): jvelociter: " the plugin appends .xml to the document that do not have the extensions" why is that ? it's not what this plugin should do and it's not what it even did before http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XPXARPLUGIN-1 AFAIK  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:56): this name of file is generated by core exporter and only by that  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:56): thomasmortagne: ok, right  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:56): if xar plugin modify files in any manner it's a bug IMO  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:56): indeed it does not touch the file  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:56): so the problem is :  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:57): why the plugin searches for Space.Page.xml when the package.xml states "Space.Page"   
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:57): c.f.  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:57): Embedded error: /Users/jvelociter/xwiki-sources/trunks/applications/selenium/target/classes/Selenium/SeleniumTestClassSheet.xml isn't a file.  
jvelociter - (22/10/2008 14:57): <file language="" defaultAction="0">Selenium.SeleniumTestClassSheet</file>  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:57): if the problem is that the plugin did not found the wiki page in the sources the error is wrong  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:58): it should say that it can't find Selenium.SeleniumTestClassSheet  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:58): and yes it's a error  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:58): (IMO)  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:58): as it's an error for the importer AFAIK  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 14:59): btw this error make me think there is a problem in the plugin implementation  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:00): and it does not looks like what we discuss on how to do that, dan\_miron ?  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:02): the plugin should not tryed to generate files names from what it find in package.xml (because it's impossible) but use the list from package.xml to filter files one by one  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:02): i'm going to look at the code  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:04): are you saying, thomas, that the plugin should look for files whose name resemble with the one specified in package.xml, no matter if they are ordinary files or xml ones?  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:06): no i'm saying files names has nothing to do here, the wiki page name is located in the files (as I already sayd you should look at how package.xml is generated) so the plugin should get the page name form file one by one and then check if the file has to be included in the package if it is listed in existing package.xml  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:07): oh, i see now  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:08): seems Sergiu wpplyed it too quickly I will revert it and let you fix the patch  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:08): anyway i planned to not apply anything before you finish the unit tests  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:08): it's just i wasn't expecting that a page name could differ from it's corresponding file name  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:09): as for the tests, i already found some maven plugin testing tools and wrote some code, and now i'm working on making it actually perform the tests  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:10): ok good  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:11): ?and there is also one more issue:  from what it has been discussed here  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:11): basically, the xarplugin should seek out for package.xml in the resouce folder and take the rest of the files from target/classes?  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:11): when building the archive  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 15:12): dan\_miron: why?  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 15:12): I don't understand why you're making a difference between package.xml and the other files?  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 15:13): they should all come from target/classes IMO  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 15:13): (if package.xml exists of course)  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:13): vmassol: well, you said that ?yes resources are meant to be in src/main/resources and are copied in target/classes by the resource plugin  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:13): (03:49:09 PM) vmassol: it's important we take them from there  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:13): (03:49:24 PM) vmassol: since there can other plugins/tx that make modifications to them too  
vmassol - (22/10/2008 15:13): yes and I maintain that :)  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:13): but on the other side,  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:14): vmassol: the problem is that the plugin need to make a difference between previously generated package.xml and source package.xml  
xwikibot - (22/10/2008 15:14): Plugins.ApplicationManagerPlugin was modified by xwiki:XWiki.serasset - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Plugins/ApplicationManagerPlugin  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:15): if there is a package.xml from a previous buid in target/classed, but we remove the one from resource  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:15): so it can't just look at target/classes  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:15): and try to rebuild the project, the plugin will find the old package.xml which it'll take into account  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:16): maybe a solution would be to not generate package.xml in target/classes but directly write it in the xar package  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:17): it would work  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:18): IMO it sounds like a good sollution  
thomasmortagne - (22/10/2008 15:18): ok so if no one is objecting let go this way ;)

dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:22): thomas, but still this doesn't make things clear enough: if there is an existing package.xml in the resources, it'll be automatically copied in target/classes  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:27): and if we remove it from resources and then rebuild the project, the plugin will find package.xml in target/classes and take it into account  
dan\_miron - (22/10/2008 15:28): unless we set  up ?the plugin to look for package.xml in resources and not in target/classes
